blockingIssues.description: Reference project does not demonstrate .context() builder API. Feature description explicitly requires builder-pattern usage of .input()/.context()/.hints()/.onError(), but no command chain in examples/reference/src/cli.ts invokes .context(). The API exists and is well-tested in @outfitter/cli â€” it just needs to be used in at least one command in the reference project.

Migration doc sections 6 (Output Truncation) and 7 (File Pointers) lack explicit before/after code pairs. Feature description requires each of 8 entries to include before/after code and migration steps. These sections have migration steps and new API code but no 'Before (v0.5)' / 'After (v0.6)' contrast. Note: truncation and file pointers are entirely new features (no prior API existed), so 'before' would show the absence of the feature or manual approaches.

suggestedGuidanceUpdates.suggestion: The library-worker skill procedure is package-centric and assumes changes under packages/<pkg>. For reference/example-project work under examples/, the strict red-phase and package-specific verification guidance is not always a natural fit. Consider adding a note or alternate workflow for examples/ work.
suggestedGuidanceUpdates.evidence: Feature os-358-reference-project worker session handoff noted this mismatch. The worker's skillFeedback.suggestedChanges flagged that the library-worker skill's package-centric focus doesn't align with example project creation.

suggestedGuidanceUpdates.suggestion: The docs-worker skill procedure requires lint + typecheck + test in verification, but the migration-v06-docs worker only ran lint while reporting followedProcedure=true. Consider enforcing all three validators or clarifying which are required for docs-only changes.
